qas.question: Who was blamed for the week long rebellion of 1866?

answers.text: anarchists and the Church, specifically the Archbishop of Palermo

qas.question: Which families help to start cultural, industrial, and economic growth in Palermo?

answers.text: Florio, the Ducrot, the Rutelli, the Sandron, the Whitaker, the Utveggio

qas.question: In what style were the villas in the new expanded Palermo?
Which theatre was designed by Giovan Battista Filippo Basile ans opened in 1897?
Who prefered the Savoia kingdom to independence?
What was the seat of a rebellion in the 18th century?
What crushed the 18th century rebellion in Palermo?
Where did Palermo expand to in the early 2000's?

context: <b4_0>The majority of Sicilians<b4_0/> preferred independence to the Savoia kingdom; in 1866, <b5_0>Palermo<b5_0/> became the seat of a week-long popular rebellion, which was finally crushed after <b6_0>Martial law<b6_0/> was declared. <b7_0>The Italian government<b7_0/> blamed <a0_0>anarchists and the Church, specifically the Archbishop of Palermo<a0_0/>, for the rebellion and began enacting anti-Sicilian and anti-clerical policies. A new cultural, economic and industrial growth was spurred by several families, like the <a1_0>Florio, the Ducrot, the Rutelli, the Sandron, the Whitaker, the Utveggio<a1_0/>, and others. In the early twentieth century Palermo expanded <b8_0>outside the old city walls<b8_0/>, mostly to the north along the new boulevards Via Roma, Via Dante, Via Notarbartolo, and Viale della Libertà. These roads would soon boast a huge number of villas in the <a2_0>Art Nouveau<a2_0/> style. Many of these were designed by the famous architect Ernesto Basile. The Grand Hotel Villa Igiea, designed by Ernesto Basile for the Florio family, is a good example of Palermitan Art Nouveau. The huge <a3_0>Teatro Massimo<a3_0/> was designed in the same period by Giovan Battista Filippo Basile, and built by the Rutelli & Machì building firm of the industrial and old Rutelli Italian family in Palermo, and was opened in 1897.
